snippet: Nyasasaurus parringtoni was the size of a Labrador retriever but with a five-foot-long tail. It roamed the earth about 243 million years ago.
abstract: Study in journal Biology Letters reports discovery of what may have been earliest known dinosaur, dog-sized creature called Nyasasaurus parringtoni; dinosaur's bones were found in Tanzania in 1930s, but had not been extensively tested.
lead_paragraph: Nyasasaurus parringtoni was the size of a Labrador retriever but with a five-foot-long tail. It roamed the earth about 243 million years ago.

headline.print_headline: The Earliest Dinosaur, Or Maybe Its Closest Kin
headline.main: The Earliest Dinosaur, or Maybe Its Closest Kin
